did.abstract: One deed and supporting documentation regarding burial plots in Cypress Hills Cemetery purchased by William Randell (or Randall) of Newtown, Queens in 1864. Randell's family owned Randall's Island in the East River and was connected by marriage to the Vanderveer and Rapelye families of Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: William Randell, of the family after which Randall's Island in the East River is named, married Adrianna Morrell in 1836. Their eldest daughter Catharine, born soon after they married, was the last of the family to be born on the island. Catharine later married Jacob Polhemus Vanderveer. Their son William Randell Vanderveer (1863-1951) was named after his grandfather. Their daughter Gertrude (d. 1939) married John D. Rapelye.
